I didn't pay too much attention in Beta 2 but after upgrading to Beta 3 I'm concern.

Steps to reproduce
------------------
Run Sample Code:
```powershell
## - Connect and run T-SQL query
$Global:getSvr = "mtrinidadlt2,1437";
$Global:con = "server=$Global:getSvr;database=Master;Integrated Security=false;User ID=sa;" + 'Password=$Adm1n!';
$SqlQry = @'
sp_who2
'@;

$sda = New-Object System.Data.SqlClient.SqlDataAdapter ($SqlQry, $global:con)
$sdt = New-Object System.Data.DataTable
$sda.fill($sdt) | Out-Null

$sdt.rows | Select -first 5 | Format-Table
```

Expected behavior
-----------------
DataRow data to provide proper objects results column with its data value. It works in Windows PowerShell.
(See Image)
![pswindatarowok_2017-07-12_13-55-58](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19892435/28132356-9fd1071e-670a-11e7-9236-b715cf3a9b77.jpg)

Actual behavior
---------------
Seems like a Python list array result: (See image)
![pscoredatarowissue_2017-07-12_13-55-58](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19892435/28132161-08d0fcb6-670a-11e7-9a40-4a56b899465a.jpg)

Environment data
----------------
Both OS's:
Windows 10 Build 16237
Ubuntu 16.04.02

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
PS C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6.0.0-beta.3> $PSVersionTable

----                           -----

SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0

```

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: `System.Data.DataRow` and `System.Data.DataRowView` are back in .NET Core, but powershell hasn't enabled the corresponding object adapters.

comments.author: MaximoTrinidad
comments.body:
At least I got a 63 line-of-code workaround to handle the issue.  This way I can still demo creating a PowerShell script to query a SQL table and build the proper DataRow result to a PSObject.

But, it would be nice to have back to one line of code.

:)

title: PowerShell Core - System.Data DataRow not providing the correct result.
